title: Traditional Cacio e Pepe
description: Cacio e Pepe is a classic Italian pasta dish consisting of simple ingredients that create a rich and creamy flavor with a hint of peppery spice. This recipe ensures authenticity by focusing on technique and quality ingredients.

steps.step: Fill a large pot with water, add a generous amount of salt, and bring to a boil.
Add the spaghetti and cook until it is just shy of al dente, about 1 minute less than the package instructions.
Reserve 1 cup of pasta water and then drain the spaghetti.
While the pasta is cooking, in a large skillet, heat the freshly ground black pepper over medium heat for about 1 minute to release its fragrant oils.
Add about 2 ladles of the reserved pasta water to the skillet and bring to a simmer.
Transfer the cooked spaghetti into the skillet with the simmering pepper-water mixture.
Add half of the grated Pecorino Romano cheese and begin tossing the pasta quickly using tongs or a pasta fork to combine the cheese with the pasta.

Gradually add more cheese and some reserved pasta water as needed to create a creamy sauce that clings to the pasta, continuing to toss until well combined. Adjust the consistency with more pasta water if necessary, ensuring the sauce is smooth and glossy.
Taste and adjust seasoning with salt and more black pepper if desired.
Divide the pasta among four bowls, making sure each portion is well-coated with sauce.
Serve immediately while hot, topped with additional grated Pecorino Romano cheese if desired.
